covar_corrcoef_test.cpp

Calculates the coefficient of correlation of the data vectors "x" and "y". Given two data vectors and of length , the function calculates the coefficient of correlation given as

where is the covariance between the two vectors (see also covariance(const Array< double >&, const Array< double >&)) and and are the standard deviations of and respectively.
The coefficient of correlation is used to show the dependence between and . It always holds and the greater the value of is, the greater is the dependence between and .

Parameters:
x first data vector.
y second data vector.
Returns:
the coefficient of correlation.
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that x is not one-dimensional or x has not the same size than y
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1998
Changes
none
Status
stable
00001 //===========================================================================
00054 //===========================================================================
00055 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00056 #include "LinAlg/linalg.h"
00057 
00058 using namespace std;
00059 
00060 // No. of rows and columns of the
00061 // data vector matrix:
00062 const unsigned max_rows = 2;
00063 const unsigned max_cols = 3;
00064 
00065 // Values used for the initialization
00066 // of the data vector matrix and the
00067 // single data vectors:
00068 double init_values[ max_rows ][ max_cols ] = { 
00069    {1., 1., 3.},
00070    {-4., 3., 2.}
00071 };
00072 
00073 
00074 int main()
00075 {
00076   // Current row and column of the data vector matrix:
00077   unsigned        curr_row, curr_col; 
00078 
00079   // The data vector matrix, the two single data vectors,
00080   // the covariance and coefficient of correlation matrizes
00081   // for the data vector matrix:
00082   Array< double > input_mat( max_rows, max_cols ),  
00083                   x_vec( max_cols ), y_vec( max_cols ),
00084                   covar_mat, corrcoef_mat;
00085 
00086   // The covariance and coefficient of correlation values for
00087   // the single data vectors:
00088   double          covar, corrcoeff;
00089 
00090   // Initialize data vector matrix and single data vectors
00091   // with the same values:
00092   for ( curr_row = 0; curr_row < max_rows; curr_row++ )
00093   {
00094     for ( curr_col = 0; curr_col < max_cols; curr_col++ )
00095     {
00096       input_mat( curr_row, curr_col ) = init_values[ curr_row ][ curr_col ];
00097       if ( curr_row == 0 ) 
00098       {
00099           x_vec( curr_col ) = init_values[ curr_row ][ curr_col ];
00100       }
00101       else 
00102       {
00103           y_vec( curr_col ) = init_values[ curr_row ][ curr_col ];
00104       }
00105     }
00106   }  
00107 
00108   // Calculate covariance matrix for the data vector matrix
00109   // and covariance value for the single data vectors:
00110   covar_mat = covariance( input_mat );
00111   covar = covariance( x_vec, y_vec );
00112 
00113   // Calculate coefficient of correlation matrix for the data vector matrix
00114   // and coefficient of correlation value for the single data vectors:
00115   corrcoef_mat = corrcoef( input_mat );
00116   corrcoeff = corrcoef( x_vec, y_vec );
00117 
00118   // Output of the input matrix and vectors and the results:
00119   cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00120   writeArray( input_mat, cout );
00121   cout << "covariance matrix for the input matrix:" << endl;
00122   writeArray( covar_mat, cout );
00123   cout << "coefficient of correlation matrix for the input matrix:" << endl;
00124   writeArray( corrcoef_mat, cout );
00125 
00126   cout << "data vector x:" << endl;
00127   writeArray( x_vec, cout );
00128   cout << "data vector y:" << endl;
00129   writeArray( y_vec, cout );
00130   cout << "covariance for the data vectors x and y: " << covar << endl;
00131   cout << "coefficient of correlation for the data vectors x and y: " 
00132        << corrcoeff << endl;
00133 
00134   return 0;
00135 }
